text: Calder's horn traffic traffic traffic
it's an unfortunate reality of living or
traveling in a big city the traffic here
is amongst the worst on earth nobody
likes being stuck in traffic but
sometimes it's the only way to get from
point A to point B as you have heard
about the horrible events happening
right now in Bangladesh extreme traffic
and unsafe road conditions are killing
people when they shouldn't be killed we
all need to take Bangladeshis lead and
demand for safer streets the following
are the 5 worst traffic cities in the
world as I've seen with my own two eyes
number 5 Delhi I was in India in March
2015 before I made videos but this was
my first time experiencing traffic jams
this severe people use the horn of more
than they use the gas and no a/c in most
taxis and of course the chip tubes mixed
with the fumes of the cars was making me
sick number 4 Bangkok it is about 6 p.m.
and we're here on a small little
neighborhood side street and you can
just see all the traffic behind me I
mean it's non-stop what I don't
understand is how traffic can be so
miserable when there is an efficient
underground and overground public
transportation system no other city on
this list has this yet there is still a
traffic jam 24/7 motorbike taxis make
life a little bit easier to cut the
cards but is quite dangerous number
three Kampala alright we are stuck in a
rush hour here in Kampala and the
traffic is horrible amongst the worst
I've ever seen in the world
Uganda's capital is on another level of
hectic I was driving cross-country
earlier this year when we had to cut
through the city which Google Maps said
it would take 30 minutes but it ended up
being three hours we waited so long that
roller bladers started grabbing on to
trucks
number two Manila I've spent about 6
months combined in Manila
and it seems like one of those months
was sitting in traffic it's a nightmare
look at this Mondays and Fridays are the
worst so I would advise you to just stay
at home between 7:00 a.m. and 10:00 p.m.
but there's people like selling stuff on
the tracks right there number one dacha
what both sides of the road before us
there's no question that dacha is number
one on this list and I'm not just saying
that to give empathy during the current
situation it's the truth
it took me four hours to drive five
kilometres when I could have walked it
and half that time the roads are
dangerous uneven congested and they need
to be fixed immediately
other notable cities with terrible
traffic that would come next on this
list are Cairo Jakarta Los Angeles
Istanbul
Mumbai and Colombo and lastly to all my
friends in Bangladesh I haven't forgot
about you and I'm hoping for some kind
of reform soon keep fighting for it
because we are all standing with you
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
